result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin L. Hanson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed/stayed, with work release.  Consecutive to 13CF85.
Consecutive to: 13CF85

Conditions:

Submit to AODA and follow all recommendations of the counselor.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming ordered by the agent.

Pay costs.If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Defendant was revoked from probation on May 5, 2015.  Judge Sharp received the Revocation Order and Warrant on May 13, 2015 and has since directed the Clerk of Court to produce an amended JOC.  Per Judge Sharp's order, the stay of jail shall be lifted and the 6 months jail previously imposed now served.

Credit to be determined by the institution.

Costs in this case are to be converted to a civil judgment due and payable to the Clerk of Court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

with request to the Court that the stay be lifted and the Court impose the 6 months jail on this case (document forwarded to Judge Sharp for review this date)
Plea & Sentencing Hearing held this 9th Day of December 2014.
1 doc filed for 3 cases - stored in 13CF85

Defendant Justin L. Hanson in court with attorney David W. Franker. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  4 cases called together:
13CF85/pleas.
14CF38/pleas.
14CF61/pleas.
14CF87/adjourned initial
Counsel inform the Court that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution.  DA Harper details the agreement which calls for the def's plea of GNC to count 1, as a felony bail jumping, in 14CF87 for a 4-year diversion agreement.  Further, in 13CF85, State will be moving to dismiss/read in count 1/burglary and moving to amend count 2 from theft to misdemeanor bail jumping.  In 14CF38, the State will move to amend felony bail jumping to misd. bail jumping.  In 14CF61, State will move to amend count 1/felony bail jumping to misd. bail jumping and move to dismiss/read in count 2.  Per Harper, the joint recommendation for sentencing on the misd. bail jumping charges is 6 mo jail on each count, consecutive to one another, imposed/stayed for 24 months probation with AODA/treatment and costs as conditions and restitution of $810.00 to C Colson (13CF85).  46 days credit to be applied to 13CF85. 

14CF87/prelim waived, information filed, and def enters no contest plea to count 1/felony bail jumping.  Def pleads no contest to the remaining charges included in the agreement, all misd. bail jumping.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  

Finding of guilty to all plead counts.  Sentence withheld for 4 year diversion agreement in 14CF87.

Sentence in the remaining matters:
13CF85 - Count 2 - 6 mo in the county jail with work release and 46 days overall credit, imposed/stayed, for 24 months probation.  Count 1 DRI.
14CF38 - Count 1 - 6 mo in the county jail, consecutive to 13CF85, imposed/stayed, for 24 months probation.
14CF61 - Count 1 - 6 mo in the county jail, consecutive to 13CF85 and, imposed/stayed, for 24 months probation.
Conditions of probation:  AODA/follow through recommendations of the counselor.  Restitution of $810 to C Colson in 13CF85.  Any counseling/education/programming as directed by agent.  Pay costs. Count 2 DRI.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-09-2014 03:30 pm

Attorney David W. Franker appeared by phone means for Defendant Justin L. Hanson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  4 cases called together:  14CF87, 14CF38, 14CF61, 13CF85.  Atty. Franker asks that all matter be adjourned; he is not available today due to court obligations in another county.  Court adjourns all to Dec. 9 at 3:30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-08-2014 10:00 am
Residence requirement deleted.

Defendant Justin L. Hanson in court, in custody, without counsel; has Atty. Franker as defense counsel, however, Atty. Franker is unable to be here due to med. condition.  4 cases called together.  DA Harper, for the State, informs the Court that the parties had an agreement to resolve these matters; that agreement would have resulted in def's release from jail this date.  In lieu of what has occurred,  DA is asking for the following bond modifications:

14CF61 - $2500 cash bond to be amended to $2500 signature bond.  No special conditions requested.
14CF38 - there is already a signature bond - but it should be amended to delete the residence requirement - so just a 10k sig bond
13CF85 - there is already a 10k signature bond - but residence and curfew requirements are to be deleted - no contact prohibitions from original bond remain in effect
14CF87 - bond has not yet been set - State requests 10k signature bond and def needs to be printed

All matters reset for Monday, Dec. 8 at 10:00.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-04-2014 03:30 pm

Defendant Justin L. Hanson in court, in custody, with attorney David W. Franker. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel have indicated that they wish to jointly resolve multiple cases, this one included.  Plea/sentencing set for tomorrow at 3:30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 4, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference at 12-03-2014 02:30 pm
Status conference on December 15, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
request from Atty. Franker to reschedule the Dec. 5th hearing due to scheduling conflict in Dane County Court
Status conference on December 5, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Justin L. Hanson in court, in custody, with attorney David W. Franker. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  4 cases called together:  
14CF61/initial
14CF71/initial
13CF85/status
14CF38/status
Formal reading waived in 14CF61 and 14CF71.  Charges stated.  Max. penalties stated.  Rights stated.  DA states that 14CF61 and 14CF71 stem from the same bail jumping incident (may be duplicative charges); DA has these matters under review though not moving to dismiss either at this time.  These cases to be set for prelim.  Atty. Franker states that the def has waived the prelim time limits.  Court accepts waiver of time limits.  

12/5 at 2:45 for prelim in 14CF61 and 14CF71; that date/time for status in 13CF85 and 14CF38; potential request for bail modification that day/time as well.  Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
Status conference on November 11, 2014 at 11:00 am.

DA Harper, Def by video from the Richland County Jail, and Atty. Edwards.  Atty. Edwards has motioned to withdraw from this case.  Court allows withdrawal.  SPD to re-appoint.  Matter has already been set for further status Nov. 11 at 11:00 when other SPD counsel is in Richland County on other matters.  Status conference scheduled for 11-11-2014 at 11:00 am.
to withdraw

Bond conditions amended August 20, 2014 as follows:  Def may be released only to his mother Shawna Hanson and must reside with her at the residence at E15775 Lincoln Drive, Fall Creek, WI.  Def to be inside that residence, on curfew, from 10 p.m. to 6 a.m.
Status conference on November 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

13CF85 and 14CF38 - called this date at 11:38 a.m. at request of Atty. Edwards for review of bond.  Def was originally on cash bond in 14CF38 but that was converted to signature bond during the time def was in a treatment facility.  DA asks that, since def brought himself back to Richland County following that treatment, he be admitted to $10K signature bond with condition that he be released to mother SH with curfew of 10 p.m. to 6 a.m.  DA states that def has an address where he shall reside.  Atty. E states that address is listed on the complaint:  Fall Creek address on Lincoln Drive.

Court amends bond to 10K sig with cond that he only be release to mother SH and that he be on curfew, inside residence, from 10 p.m. to 6 a.m., and must reside at E15775 Lincoln Drive, Fall Creek, WI.  This will be for 14CF38.

Bond conditions will be the same in 13CF85 with the exception that 13CF85 also has no condition conditions that will remain in effect.

Nov. 5th at 1:30 for status in both.  Status conference scheduled for 11-05-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Order to Transport

Hansons bond will be amended to a 10K signature bond, ONCE HE IS IN THE TX facility in Chippewa Falls.   

 A condition of the bond is that he remain in the Tx facility until he is formally discharged from the facility.  A condition of the bond is that he must 1) call the Richland County Sheriffs Department on the day he is being released to advise that he is being released 2) he must also get a discharge slip from the facility that includes the date and TIME he is released.  

A condition of bond is that he must return to the Richland County Jail within 6 hours of being released from the Tx facility.   
 
The bond will revert back into the 10K CASH bond six hours after his release from the facility.
Status conference on September 3, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Suzanne Edwards in court with Defendant Justin L. Hanson (in custody). Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA Harper states there is a waiver for prelim and requests modification of bond. Court's colloquy re. prelim waiver. Def waives preliminary hearing. Further colloquy. Court accepts def's waiver of right to preliminary hearing, binds def over for trial. DA Harper states modification of bond request. No objection by Atty E. On motion of both parties, Court will amend the bond as requested.  Status conference scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Justin L. Hanson via video from jail.  Attorney Suzanne Edwards appears in person.   Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty E. has received a copy of the complaint, waives formal reading. Court informs def of the charge/max possible penalties. Atty E. requests matter be set for status rather than prelim, waives time limits for prelim. DA states there is another case to be filed in conjunction with this matter. Atty E. requests bond modification to signature bond. Court denies signature bond. Comment by DA Harper, requests increase in cash bond, no-contact with parent's residence @  E15775 Lincoln Dr, Fall Creek, WI. Court orders bond to be raised to $10,000, will not impose the no-contact order.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 9, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Def in person and in custody without counsel. DA Harper for the State. DA states def was picked up on a warrant in this matter, requests $5000 cash. Def requests signature bond. Court orders $5000 cash bond. Court directs the def to contact PD office to be appointed an attorney. Will reset this matter to tomorrow at 10:30.
Disposition of Warrant or Commitment (from Sheriff's Dept.)
